title: Map of Slave Trade Out of Africa - conclusions

content.question: Which of the following conclusions can best be drawn from the data presented on the map?

choices.label: Slavery as an institution was confined to the Western Hemisphere.
More enslaved people were brought to Jamaica than were brought to Brazil.
The different ethnic origins of the enslaved Africans led to varied cultural contributions in the Americas.
The number of Africans in the Atlantic slave trade never overtook the number in the trans-Saharan slave trade.

content.answer: The different ethnic origins of the enslaved Africans led to varied cultural contributions in the Americas.

topic.text: 2.2: Departure Zones in Africa and the Slave Trade to the United States

skill.text: 2.D: Describe and draw conclusions from patterns, trends, and limitations in data, making connections to relevant course content.
